text: Which option should the robot choose in this situation?

options.label: Option A – Extra safety, slower delivery
Option B – Mild risk, on-time delivery

help_text: Please select the option that best matches what you think the robot ought to do.

text: How acceptable is your preferred option overall?
help_text: If you chose 'neither / cannot decide', rate the option you lean toward most.

text: Is there any option the robot should never use in situations like this?

options.label: No, both options could be acceptable
The robot should never choose Option A
The robot should never choose Option B

help_text: Use this to indicate if you see any option as morally unacceptable, not just less preferred.

text: If the robot moves slowly and avoids any chance of bumping someone, but the delivery is late, how acceptable is that tradeoff to you?
help_text: Assume there is no serious harm either way; this question is about your attitude toward delay for extra safety.

text: If the robot moves faster and there is a small chance of lightly bumping someone (no serious injury), how acceptable is that tradeoff to you?
help_text: This is about your tolerance for minor physical risk in order to keep tasks on time.

text: When you chose your preferred option, which of the following reasons mattered to you? (Select all that apply.)

options.label: Getting the job done quickly / on time
It seems like a reasonable balance between safety and speed
Treating everyone in the corridor fairly

help_text: These reasons help us understand which values you were prioritizing in this scenario.

text: In general, for robots in public spaces, how much more important is avoiding even minor physical harm compared to keeping tasks on time?
scale_min_label: 1 – Keeping tasks on time is much more important
scale_max_label: 5 – Avoiding even minor harm is much more important
help_text: Choose 3 if you see them as equally important.

text: If you want to explain your choices in your own words, please do so here.
help_text: Optional. You can describe anything you think is missing from the options above.
